articles.description: Great Britain's Poppy Maskill wins her third gold medal of the Paralympics in Paris with victory in the women's S10 100m backstroke.
articles.title: Paralympics 2024: Poppy Maskill wins third Para-swimming gold in Paris

articles.description: Britain's Jack Draper has produced the standout run of his career to reach the US Open semi-finals - but world number one Jannik Sinner stands in his path to Sunday's final.
articles.title: US Open 2024: How does Jack Draper beat Jannik Sinner in New York semi-final?

articles.description: New national head coach Craig Bellamy speaks of his "pull" to return to Wales, where he will build on the legacy of his friend, the late great Gary Speed.
articles.title: Craig Bellamy: Calling back to Wales with memories of Gary Speed

articles.description: Alfie Hewett wins his first Paralympics gold medal, partnering Gordon Reid to victory in the wheelchair tennis men's doubles in Paris.
articles.title: Paralympics 2024 wheelchair tennis: Alfie Hewett and Gordon Reid win men's doubles gold

articles.description: The Kansas City Chiefs make a winning start to their NFL title defence as the Baltimore Ravens have a late touchdown overturned.
articles.title: NFL: Kansas City Chiefs win season opener as late Baltimore Ravens score ruled out

articles.description: Josh Inglis' magnificent hundred helps Australia to a comfortable win over Scotland in the second T20 international of their three-match series.
articles.title: Scotland v Australia second T20: Josh Inglis hundred helps visitors to victory

articles.description: New Zealand and South Africa's proposed revival of long-haul tours could cause the Rugby Championship to be held every other year.
articles.title: Rugby Championship set to be halved by new All Black-Boks tour
